page.title: 07UPPER ROADSIDE, TEMPLETON.
page.content: Upper Roadside is a farm which sells fruit and vegetables.The main crop is strawberries.Mr Curphey gets up at 6:00am in summer.He picks and weighs the strawberries.From 9:00 people may come in to pick and buy strawberries. Mr Curphey enjoys the job.He also sells runner beans,raspberries and hay.He uses quite a lot of machinery in the fields,including a sprayer, rotavator,cultivator,roller and hay cutting machine.This year he has used an irrigation system.He has 10 acres for strawberry growing and sells about 10,000 pounds of strawberries a year.The price of strawberries varies between 30 pence and Â£1:00 per pound, depending on the quality.Children are allowed to pick strawberries.Mr Curphey has 2 cats,1 dog and some sheep and cattle.He grows swedes for the sheep.
